intro: Canthium glabrum, commonly known as the smooth spurge or smallleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub with simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, which are characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family. Canthium glabrum is known for its toxic properties, with all parts of the plant containing irritants that can cause skin inflammation.
